poem:
Title: "Eloquent Grip on Silicon Giants"

Scott Galloway, NYU's reluctant bard,
Talks of tech bros playing poker with fate.
He tells of luck confused with plaudits,
And in our ears, sleek morsels of truth reverberate.
Within the wires, software's ghost converses,
Hearts of silicon held in ruthless debate.
A trusty guide in digital universe's,
Against the gales of tech, he stands irate.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Pivot podcast host Scott Galloway: ‘Tech bros conflate luck with talent’ Scott Galloway is an American professor of marketing at New York University Stern school of Business. He has founded and sold several tech firms, and served on the board of directors of companies such as the New York Times and Urban Outfitters. With tech journalist Kara Swisher he co-hosts the hugely popular tech and business podcast Pivot. He is a fierce critic of tech". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
